The cooking steps are extracted based on the sequence of actions described by Jacques Pepin, starting with preparing the beans and bacon, seasoning the mixture, cooking the beans, preparing the garnish, and finally serving the chili.
dish_description: The dish is a chili with red beans, which includes ground beef, bacon, and a variety of seasonings and garnishes such as salsa, celery, onion, garlic, jalapeno, cilantro, and cheese. It is cooked slowly to allow the flavors to meld and the beans to become tender.

cooking_steps.description: Cut a couple of slices of bacon into little pieces.
Wash half a pound of red beans and place them in a pot with 4 cups of cold water.
Add 1 and a half teaspoons of salt, 1 and a half teaspoons of chili powder, half a teaspoon of coriander, and half a teaspoon of cumin powder to the pot.
Bring the pot to a boil and then cook gently covered for 1 and a half hours.
Prepare the garnish by chopping approximately 3/4 cup of celery, 1 and a half cups of onion, 4 or 5 cloves of garlic, and 3 to 4 tablespoons of jalapeno pepper.
Add the garnish to the pot after the beans have been cooking for an hour and a half, then bring to a boil and cook on low heat for another hour.
Cut frozen cilantro stems and add about a quarter of a cup to the chili.
Serve the chili with optional toppings such as strong cheddar cheese, minced onion, and fresh cilantro. It can be served in tortillas or iceberg lettuce leaves.
